heading: Hammer of the Ancients Barbarian Endgame Build Guide
content: Welcome to the Diablo 4 Hammer of the Ancients (HotA) Barbarian Endgame Build Guide! This is a fan-favorite skill that returns to the franchise for Barbarians. While it naturally has a very small area of effect, we solve this by using Tempered Size and the (which, conveniently, can always be imprinted via the ). These drastically increase the radius of the impact, allowing us to obliterate almost full screens of enemies. , we take a lot of the standard tools for the endgame. Our main generator, , is used to keep our levels high and grant us the status, which we can keep up permanently. To help keep things comfy, we also pick up two powerful shouts: for a massive chunk of damage reduction and increased Maximum Life, and generation. We also have as an Ultimate to fall back on for a multiplicative damage boost, generation, and a very generous Attack Speed buff. With all of this at our disposal, nothing can withstand the pure power that can deliver. And with that... let's start smashing! The Season 9 theme is the . This season allows you to craft unique using three different components: a , and three through the Seasonal Questline, and can be found while exploring . You choose a Skill as the trigger for your . Once in Torment I or higher, can be crafted which replace the Gems in your Jewelry, that add additional power to your build. as it has a long duration and is incredibly reliable. As long as you are positioned between the enemy and the , it applies its effects to the target. Infusion is taken for the damage reduction it grants. The Arsenal System allows us to use a specific weapon for every attack skill, with each weapon granting different bonuses. We also have what is called the Technique Slot. With this, we can use any weapon of our choosing to always reap the benefit from, regardless of which weapon we have equipped. is our main (and only) weapon of choice, since requires a Two-Handed Bludgeoning Weapon. It has a great secondary effect that increases our Critical Strike Damage multiplier, and since we are built to cap our Critical Strike Chance, we are benefitting from this essentially always.
